intro: Malouetia duckei, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, flame-colored inflorescences that bloom in summer. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental species. Due to its rapid growth and ability to tolerate various conditions, it is often used in landscaping and reforestation projects.
